elements.title: a portrait of him (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Paul Revere's daughter had a portrait of him (pictured) revised, as it depicted him dressed informally?

elements.title: Battle of Edington (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Tudor historian Polydore Vergil erroneously wrote that the site of the Battle of Edington was in Abingdon?

elements.title: Caro mio ben (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the arietta "Caro mio ben" has been attributed to three Giordanis, one of whom was unrelated to the other two?

elements.title: Achmad Husein (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Achmad Husein required municipal employees of Banyumas to collect 1 kg (2.2 lb) of inorganic waste each month?

elements.title: Marymount station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Superstring at Marymount station features child-like drawings of the sun, a singing bird, and cryptic messages on babies and saving water?

elements.title: Tan Boon Chiang (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tan Boon Chiang awarded four cases of PepsiCo soft drinks to each worker in Singapore after rejecting their claim for higher wages?

elements.title: American crow (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the American crow is considered to be a sign of good luck in Native American cultures?

elements.title: a staircase in Lyon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tony Hawk described ollieing a staircase in Lyon as "one of the greatest feats in skateboarding history"?

elements.title: Bob Comfort (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bob Comfort, an atheist, made up a religion when ordered to pick one while serving in the United States military?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
